text: [Music]
hello my name is Mark K I'm the Dennis
fairy family professor in the
Departments of Pediatrics and genetics
at Stanford University today I want to
introduce you to a course on Gene
Therapeutics throughout this course I
will try to illustrate many different
examples that have General properties
that are applicable to all Gene
Therapeutics I'm going to show you
examples not only of the successes but
also some of the setbacks and what we
need to do to continue to get uh Gene
Therapeutics into more widespread
clinical application and you're going to
be fortunate to hear Dr Maria graia
ranala who is one of the investigators
who was first involved with some of
these early amuno deficiency gene
therapy uh trial
give a couple guest lectures on some of
the clinical trials both for these
immune deficiency disorders as well as
some additional Gene deficiency
disorders and some other diseases so I I
really think that's going to be an
exciting highlight of this course gene
therapy was originally thought about
from the prospect of taking a single
mutation that causes disease and
basically either fixing or adding a
normal copy of the
gene so this is how gene therapy was
originally thought about but I think
you'll appreciate as we go through this
course the fact that gene therapy is now
much more widespread in what types of
diseases it might be useful for
[Music]
